Игра изначально задумывалась как хоррор,чтобы играя,вы испытывали страх от убийцы,следующего по пятам,но поиграв часов 5-10 вы понимаете,что убийца как таковой - это эдакий клоун для выживших,и создан,чтобы их развлекать,получая по голове палетами,бегая как собачка за ними,не имея возможности даже ударить в 70% случаев,промахиваясь,ударяя стены в 2 мм от выживших,на что они будут весело бегать вокруг вас и ехидно приседать.Конечно так не для всех,в этой игре присутствует свой тир лист,как и во многих,при должном подходе и наличии времени можно играть эффективно,но если вы зашли "пофаниться"раз в неделю - быстрее получите нервное расстройство,чем "фан".А так советую ознакомиться с данной игрой,так как она,по моему скромному мнения,лучше других ее аналогов,так же если играете с друзьями,она тоже вам зайдет.

Game is IMO not worth at full price. Might be worth it at very low price during a sale.

Game got old rather quick, but mainly due to poor balancing. The game isn't bad per-say, as at least the devs didn't run into any of the issues that they killed the other asymmetrical games [spoiler](actually they did, the devs just decided not to scrap it, which is both a positive and a negative, considering they recently scrapped their other project/game)[/spoiler]

The community is extremely toxic.
The most viable killers are much easier to play because their kits let them ignore the main point of the game (which is a blend of tag + hide and seek).
Some of the most viable survivor builds are designed to waste time of the killer (note this work best against the bad, underpowered killers, where some of the better killers can just ignore this due to kit)
The game still has some gamebreaking bugs after it's long development time. This of course is bad.
The game isn't as nearly as absolutely broken as it was at the start. This of course is good.
The devs apparently have a report function that I don't really believe gets proper usage outside of cheating, which even then, is somewhat of a multi-step process to report for cheating.

DLC is mainly for killers, this WOULD be good if the game was more balanced, but there's a chance any new killer that brings in a new kit can be very strong, meaning this is actually more a negative.
Also unlike some other games(mainly looking at Siege/League/Smite/Etc) where you can get ALL characters over time without spending any money or more money from the first buy-in (granted they might take awhile), there are some characters only accessible through paying more real money. Not necessarily must-haves, so more neutral.

You can't kill or fight the killer. This is more just pointing out a gameplay element. So again, neutral.
Also the game is more meant to be a game of tag with how chases work.

This game again, isn't bad per-say
But with all that, and the fact the DLC count is starting to get expensive if you want easy-access to most killers, or if you want all killers (as again, some can only be bought through DLC).
It will never be worth the full price. Save until a high sale (80% off base game and most of the DLC killers you want)

If the game was $20-30 base price, and you got free choice of 3 or so killers, with the ability to earn other killers (maybe 1 a day or two of playing), then maybe if you want to put up with bugs/toxic community it might be worth it.

Other than that, like I said, wait for a sale. You might feel better in playing the game if it's at a reduced price.
